question: The torque acting on a magnetic dipole placed in uniform magnetic field is zero, when the angle between the dipole axis and the magnetic field is
explanation: The torque on a magnetic dipole is given by <katex>$\tau = MB \sin \theta$</katex>.
For the torque to be zero, <katex>$\sin \theta = 0$</katex>, which implies <katex>$\theta = 0^{\circ}$</katex> or <katex>$180^{\circ}$</katex>.
